course.title: Unreal Engine 4: The Complete Beginner's Course
course.subtitle: Learn Video Game Development & How To Design a Game From Scratch Using UE4

reviews.body: Peu d'exercices de mise en application. Peu de pistes d'exploration. Trop de "faites les mêmes clics que moi".

I am very happy with the content of the course. I initially thought it wouldn't be much different from the videos in youtube, but I was wrong: the quality of these videos are much better than the youtube videos found for free.

I have basic programming experience coming into this course but no game development experience as a heads up. I found the content to be good for a basics course however some topics were over explained such as the function of a search bar and some were under explained. I would've liked the tutorial game to be a bit more in depth with some of the topics however it's a decent tutorial for learning the bare basics.
If you know nothing about UE4, this tutorial is a good starting point. I managed to learn how to operate inside UE4.

The Unreal Engine 4: Complete Beginner's Course is very well explained by Instructor David Nixon and completely upto the mark. This course is perfect for those wanting a basic overview of what Unreal Engine 4 really is, and of course the Demo platformer game is really satisfactory after all the concepts being learnt. All his lectures are pretty straightforward and easy to understand, there are no uses of fancy vocabulary, no manner of difficult grammar usage, perfect for anyone practically. The most impressive thing about David Nixon's explanation is that he goes on to give a clear understanding and clarity of even the tiniest of things (like importing files by dragging it from another folder to UE4 content browser or exporting audio files in Audacity) that may seem trivial to some but in actuality it's helping a lot of people!

Based on my experience and learning patterns from David's lectures, I will definitely rate this course a 10/10 !

Aside from the video being very different from the audio (Probably after editing mistake?) Its an okay tutorial series to get started. His voice is very monotone and it is quite boring so probably stay away. The information is just average and nothing about this Udemy teacher stands out as good. I suggest another beginner tutorial series

I would like to see you guys adjust how you spend lecture time versus putting lecture time to use. You need to have a Definitive Line to say Pay Attention this is not for You to work this is for you to learn, and then implement a this is where we put what you learned to work. their is some content that is redundant and some content that you cover far to quickly that is important. yes that is the benifit of a pause button But some pauses between actions insted of buzzing through them makes you feel a little less rushed and allows for you to soak in what your doing instead of trying to rush and imitate the process so you don't have to keep pausing th evideo every 10 seconds. Great job!

Good explanation of basic features of the Editor. But the Tutorials, the most important part, are wrong.

If you follow the instruction you end up with a character that is not set up properly and it glitches through walls, thats because they make the character lean forward and backward
Very Detailed and good learning experience. One suggestion, Please add reference from a game function directly when explaining about timeline nodes.
The teacher is very competent, the lessons were easy to follow and having a project to complete was really engaging.

It is great for beginners but only if you understand the basics of programming for example knowing what a loop, variable etc is. Doesn't really ask you to try this or give tasks, just shows what is the UE4 and Blueprints are all about. It feels like a 'home tour' rather than a course.

Very good course for complete beginners to Unreal & game dev in general. All of the most important UE concepts are covered in the course and there is also a nice little demo project, where the concepts are applied in a practical context.

instructor.name: David Nixon
instructor.briefIntroduction: David Nixon is a professional software developer and amateur game developer who holds a degree in Computer Science from Florida Atlantic University. He started his career developing websites and providing SEO services for companies nationwide. He then dove into the world of mobile gaming, developing the game Puzzlers. Recently, he worked as a web developer for a major SaaS company.
